attributes.action: create an additional public holiday in England on April 23 (or if it falls on a Saturday or Sunday, on the first Monday following this date), each year to commemorate St George's Day and Shakespear's birthday
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In Shakespeare's time, St George's Day was celebrated with the same amount of enthusiasm and joy as Christmas Day; the two dates were,by decree, of equal importance. Over the centuries it has been largely forgotten to the extent that some councils now even suggest that to fly the English flag on St George's Day " might put out the wrong message"
We wish to restore England's national history,heritage, tradition and pride
(A bill establishing St Andrew's Day as a bank holiday in Scotland received Royal Assent on January 15 this year
